  • Method Details

    • addSecuritycurrenciesToWatchlist

      @Transactional @Modifying public Watchlist addSecuritycurrenciesToWatchlist(Integer idWatchlist, SecuritycurrencyLists securitycurrencyLists)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Adds existing securities and/or currency pairs, identified by their IDs, to the specified watchlist.

      This operation is subject to limits defined for the watchlist (e.g., maximum number of securities or currency pairs). It typically checks if the instruments are not already present in the watchlist to avoid duplicates.

      Specified by:
      addSecuritycurrenciesToWatchlist in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist to which the instruments will be added. This watchlist must exist and be accessible to the user.
      securitycurrencyLists - A SecuritycurrencyLists object containing lists of unique IDs for existing Security and/or Currencypair entities to be added to the watchlist.
      Returns:
      The updated Watchlist entity reflecting the newly added instruments.

    • removeAllSecurityCurrency

      @Transactional @Modifying public Watchlist removeAllSecurityCurrency(Integer idWatchlist)
      Specified by:
      removeAllSecurityCurrency in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom

    • searchByCriteria

      public SecuritycurrencyLists searchByCriteria(Integer idWatchlist, SecuritycurrencySearch securitycurrencySearch)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Searches for securities and currency pairs that match the given criteria and are eligible to be added to the specified watchlist.

      This method is typically used when a user wants to find new instruments to add to an existing watchlist. Therefore, it excludes any securities or currency pairs that are already present in the specified idWatchlist from the search results.

      The search is performed within the security context of the currently authenticated user and their tenant.
      Specified by:
      searchByCriteria in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist for which new instruments are being searched. Instruments already in this watchlist will be excluded from the results. The watchlist must belong to the current user's tenant.
      securitycurrencySearch - The SecuritycurrencySearch criteria object defining the parameters for finding matching securities and currency pairs.
      Returns:
      A SecuritycurrencyLists object containing lists of Security and Currencypair entities that match the search criteria and are not already in the specified watchlist.

      @Transactional @Modifying public Watchlist saveOnlyAttributes(Watchlist watchlist, Watchlist existingEntity, Set<Class<? extends Annotation>> updatePropertyLevelClasses) throws Exception

      public int removeMultipleFromWatchlist(Integer idWatchlist, List<Integer> idsSecuritycurrency)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Removes multiple securities and/or currency pairs from a specified watchlist based on their IDs.
      Specified by:
      removeMultipleFromWatchlist in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist from which to remove the instruments.
      idsSecuritycurrency - A list of IDs for the securities/currency pairs to be removed.
      Returns:
      The number of instruments successfully removed from the watchlist.

    • delEntityWithTenant

      public int delEntityWithTenant(Integer idWatchlist, Integer idTenant)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Deletes a watchlist entity identified by its ID, but only if it belongs to the specified tenant. This is a security measure to ensure users can only delete their own watchlists.
      Specified by:
      delEntityWithTenant in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist to delete.
      idTenant - The ID of the tenant who is attempting to delete the watchlist.
      Returns:
      The number of entities deleted (0 or 1). Returns 1 if deletion was successful, 0 otherwise.

    • moveSecuritycurrency

      public Boolean moveSecuritycurrency(Integer idWatchlistSource, Integer idWatchlistTarget, Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Moves a specific security or currency pair from a source watchlist to a target watchlist. The instrument must exist in the source watchlist and the user must have appropriate permissions for both source and target watchlists.
      Specified by:
      moveSecuritycurrency in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlistSource - The ID of the source watchlist from which the instrument will be moved.
      idWatchlistTarget - The ID of the target watchlist to which the instrument will be moved.
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the security or currencypair to move.
      Returns:
      true if the instrument was successfully moved, false otherwise (e.g., if the instrument is not in the source watchlist, or if limits on the target watchlist are exceeded).

    • tryUpToIntradayDataWhenRetryIntraLoadGreaterThan0

      public SecuritycurrencyLists tryUpToIntradayDataWhenRetryIntraLoadGreaterThan0(Integer idWatchlist)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Attempts to update intraday price data for instruments (securities and currency pairs) in a given watchlist, but only for those instruments whose retry counter for intraday loading (retryIntraLoad) is greater than 0. Only users with the ADMIN role and ALL_EDIT may use this function.
      Specified by:
      tryUpToIntradayDataWhenRetryIntraLoadGreaterThan0 in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist whose instruments are to be processed.
      Returns:
      A SecuritycurrencyLists object containing the securities and currency pairs for which an intraday data update attempt was made.

    • tryUpToDateHistoricalDataWhenRetryHistoryLoadGreaterThan0

      public SecuritycurrencyLists tryUpToDateHistoricalDataWhenRetryHistoryLoadGreaterThan0(Integer idWatchlist)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Attempts to update historical end-of-day price data for instruments (securities and currency pairs) in a given watchlist, but only for those instruments whose retry counter for historical data loading (retryHistoryLoad) is greater than 0. Only users with the ADMIN role and ALL_EDIT may use this function.
      Specified by:
      tryUpToDateHistoricalDataWhenRetryHistoryLoadGreaterThan0 in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist whose instruments are to be processed.
      Returns:
      A SecuritycurrencyLists object containing the securities and currency pairs for which a historical data update attempt was made.

    • getSecuritiesCurrenciesWachlistLimits

      public TenantLimit[] getSecuritiesCurrenciesWachlistLimits(Integer idWatchlist)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Retrieves the limits for the number of securities and currency pairs that can be added to a specific watchlist. These limits might be based on tenant settings or other application rules.
      Specified by:
      getSecuritiesCurrenciesWachlistLimits in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist.
      Returns:
      An array of TenantLimit objects, typically with two elements: one for securities and one for currency pairs.

    • addInstrumentsWithPriceDataProblems

      public Watchlist addInstrumentsWithPriceDataProblems(Integer idWatchlist, IntraHistoricalWatchlistProblem ihwp)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Adds instruments (securities or currency pairs) that have known price data problems (e.g., missing historical or intraday data, as specified by ihwp) to a specified watchlist. This is useful for creating a watchlist that specifically tracks instruments requiring data attention. Only users with the ADMIN role and ALL_EDIT may use this function.
      Specified by:
      addInstrumentsWithPriceDataProblems in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - The ID of the watchlist to which the problematic instruments will be added.
      ihwp - An IntraHistoricalWatchlistProblem object specifying the criteria for identifying instruments with price data problems (e.g., type of problem, date ranges).
      Returns:
      The updated Watchlist entity, now containing the added problematic instruments.

    • getDataProviderResponseForUser

      public String getDataProviderResponseForUser(Integer idSecuritycurrency, boolean isIntraday, boolean isSecurity)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Retrieves the raw response string from the configured data provider for an instrument's price data. This method is used when the frontend needs to display data directly from the provider, especially in cases where API keys are involved and handled by the backend.
      Specified by:
      getDataProviderResponseForUser in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the security or currencypair.
      isIntraday - true to fetch intraday data, false for historical end-of-day data.
      isSecurity - true if the instrument is a Security, false if it's a Currencypair.
      Returns:
      A string containing the raw data response from the provider, or an error message/empty string if unsuccessful.

    • getDataProviderLinkForUser

      public String getDataProviderLinkForUser(Integer idSecuritycurrency, boolean isIntraday, boolean isSecurity)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Generates a URL for accessing an instrument's price data from its provider. If the provider requires an API key that should not be exposed to the frontend, this method returns a backend-redirect URL. Otherwise, it may return a direct link.
      Specified by:
      getDataProviderLinkForUser in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the security or currencypair.
      isIntraday - true for an intraday data link, false for a historical data link.
      isSecurity - true if the instrument is a Security, false if it's a Currencypair.
      Returns:
      A URL string pointing either directly to the data provider or to a backend endpoint that proxies the request.

    • getDataProviderDivSplitResponseForUser

      public String getDataProviderDivSplitResponseForUser(Integer idSecuritycurrency, boolean isDiv)
      Description copied from interface: WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Retrieves the raw response string from the configured data provider for a security's dividend or stock split information. This method is used when the frontend needs to display data directly from the provider, especially in cases where API keys are involved and handled by the backend.
      Specified by:
      getDataProviderDivSplitResponseForUser in interface WatchlistJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - The ID of the Security.
      isDiv - true to fetch dividend data, false for stock split data.
      Returns:
      A string containing the raw data response from the provider, or an error message/empty string if unsuccessful.
